revision.comment: [[November 26 Mumbai attacks]] moved to [[26 November 2008 Mumbai attacks]] over redirect: 9/11 happened in the US, the only place that uses MM-DD dating

revision.text:
{{Current}} <!-- {{Infobox militant organization |name = Deccan Mujahideen |logo = |caption = |dates = 2008 - Present |leader = |motives = |area = [[India]] |ideology = |crimes = |attacks = [[26 November 2008 Mumbai attacks]] |status = }} --> The '''Deccan Mujahiddeen'' is an [[Islam]]ist terrorist group. They do attacks inside [[India]]. They came to the attention of the public after they said they were responsible for the [[26 November 2008 Mumbai attacks|attacks on Mumbai]] on November 26, 2008.<ref name="IndiaReuters">{{cite news | url = http://in.reuters.com/article/topNews/idINIndia-36721020081126 | title = Deccan Mujahideen claims it behind Mumbai attacks - TV | publisher = Reuters India | date = 2008-11-26 | accessdate = 2008-11-26 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7751160.stm|title= Mumbai rocked by deadly attacks|publisher=BBC News|language=2008-11-26|accessdate=2008-11-26}}</ref> It is possible that the organization could be related to the [[Indian Mujahideen]].<ref>http://indiatoday.digitaltoday.in/index.php?option=com_content&issueid=71&task=view&id=15328&sectionid=4&Itemid=1</ref>
==Where the word is from== Deccan refers to the [[Deccan Plateau]] in southern India. The states of [[Andhra Pradesh]], [[Karnataka]], [[Kerala]] and [[Tamil Nadu]] lie on this plateau. The name is an anglicised from the [[Prakrit]] word ''{{IAST2|dakkhin}}''. That word comes from the [[Sanskrit]] word ''{{IAST2|dakṣiṇa-}}'' ({{lang-sa|दक्षिण}}), meaning 'South' or 'The South'.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://india.punjabilit.com/land/deccan_plateau.htm |title=Deccan Plateau |publisher=punjabilit.com |accessdate=2007-01-05 }}</ref>
'''Mujahideen''' (also spelt '''Mujahedin''') in [[Arabic]] is a "struggler". So the name Deccan Muhahideen may literally mean ''Strugglers of the South'', ''The South Strugglers'' or ''South Strugglers''.
==External links== *[http://www.mahalo.com/Deccan_Mujahideen Deccan Mujahideen] on [[Mahalo.com]]
